urls.title: Omnishambles - Mark Avery
urls.description: Have you ever had a colleague at work who promises everything but consistently delivers work which is of poor quality and usually arrives late too? They‚Äô re the worst aren‚Äô t they? They may be well-meaning, they may be the life and soul of the party and great fun socially but they are a total waste of space as far as the work environment is concerned. Over-promising and under-delivering work colleagues tend not to stay around for long. DEFRA reminds me of those colleagues. The problem is that we are

tweets.text:
To leave the environment in a better state than we found it we all need to play a part. 

If your organisation is planning a green finance nature project, you could get a grant from our Natural Environment Investment Readiness Fund! 

Apply now: https://t.co/rWe4lzm11j https://t.co/6hYlJUfTsa

Who‚Äôs seen our #BinTheWipe ads on TV?

Give us a like if you have!

Don‚Äôt worry if not ‚Äì here‚Äôs one for you to watch now!

RT if you know someone who needs to see it. 

Everyone flusher converted is a win for protecting homes, the environment & wildlife.

@EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/JWrxFkq8NV

New @EnvAgencyNW Eden Place & Etterby Terrace #Flood Newsletter Feb 2021 available: https://t.co/h7KRhfkhqG

Updates on maintenance following Feb 2020 storms, possible improvements to defences & surface water issues, & a drainage update.

#flooding #floodaware #Carlisle #Cumbria https://t.co/xhIKViJsAj

Oh dear, @AnglianWater. Once again big discarge of foul smelling water into River Hiz #chalkstream last evening. Too dark for photo so here‚Äôs reminder of previous at same spot Not an ‚Äòoutfall‚Äô here. Previous fix not fixed, maybe? @NorthHertsDC @AquiferChalk @IvelRev @EnvAgency https://t.co/kXaCvMMLl5

No action will be taken against a Herefordshire farmer John Price over his river maintenance works along the protected River Lugg, the @ForestryComm says.

Separate investigations by @NaturalEngland and the @EnvAgency are ongoing.

https://t.co/WlEZJ5Ar5h

#farminguk

It's an improving picture across the Thames Valley and Surrey, but we still have flood warnings and flood alerts in place. Check your local area at https://t.co/64gyL62UXF #floodaware #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/EO2anBN4Bn

Plans for a ¬£5.8m investment to accelerate 6‚É£ major schemes to protect communities at risk of flooding have been confirmed as part of our budget. Schemes covering Kilnhurst, Parkgate, Rawmarsh, Whiston, Laughton Common & Catcliffe are included.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

tweets.text: @EnvAgency @guardian River Chess daily sewage discharges for over 50 days end Feb to 17 April 2020 equals one event. You need 60 events using the EA counting method, in a year, before EA investigate. So how do you get to 60 events in one year using this method?

Another week and yet another example of what a failed and discredited organisation the @EnvAgency has become.

https://t.co/4DP5nBsia5

6 days to go‚Ä¶

The 3 phased #Kendal Flood Risk Management Scheme has been designed with members of the local community & partners.

6km of earth embankments and flood walls will be constructed and will include glass panels at key viewpoints.

More info‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/XTYr7iYCo9 https://t.co/33wqVDYMo3
